thinkers.name: Richard Watson
thinkers.context: Co-author exploring the intersection of evolution, development, and collective intelligence through connectionist models.

thinkers.name: Michael Levin
thinkers.context: Co-author investigating basal cognition, morphogenesis, and bioelectric networks as substrates for intelligence across biological scales.

thinkers.name: Fred Keijzer
thinkers.context: Contributor to the field of unconventional and basal cognition across phylogenetic history.

thinkers.name: Paul Lyon
thinkers.context: Scholar of basal cognition and problem-solving in biological systems without neurons.

thinkers.name: Giovanni Pezzulo
thinkers.context: Researcher exploring predictive processing and goal-directed behavior in morphogenesis and regeneration.

thinkers.name: Donald Hebb
thinkers.context: Identified Hebbian learning mechanism explaining synaptic connection modification in neural networks.

thinkers.name: William James
thinkers.context: Defined intelligence as the ability to achieve the same goal through multiple means.

thinkers.name: Richard Mills
thinkers.context: Contributor to unsupervised learning and deep model induction research.

thinkers.name: David Power
thinkers.context: Researcher on ecological networks implementing connectionist learning principles.

thinkers.name: Christoph Thies
thinkers.context: Collaborator on evolutionary individuality and fitness epistasis.

thinkers.name: Karl Friston
thinkers.context: Contributes free-energy principle approach to understanding pattern regulation and biological organization.

thinkers.name: William Bechtel
thinkers.context: Analyzes heterarchical control mechanisms and grounding of cognition in biological systems.

thinkers.name: Yann LeCun
thinkers.context: Pioneer of deep learning methods relevant to understanding artificial and biological neural computation.

thinkers.name: Geoffrey Hinton
thinkers.context: Developer of deep belief networks and foundational work in neural computation.

thinkers.name: Eörs Szathmáry
thinkers.context: Theorist of major evolutionary transitions in individuality and multilevel selection.

thinkers.name: Stuart Kauffman
thinkers.context: Foundational work on complex adaptive systems and self-organization relevant to biological computation.

concepts.name: Collective Intelligence
concepts.context: Intelligence arising from functional relationships between components rather than individual cleverness; occurs at multiple biological scales.

concepts.name: Basal Cognition
concepts.context: Cognition occurring in non-neural substrates and evolutionary precursors; substrate-independent problem-solving observable across phylogeny.

concepts.name: Morphogenesis
concepts.context: Developmental process involving collective cell intelligence to achieve anatomical goals despite perturbations; instantiation of basal cognition.

concepts.name: Connectionist Models
concepts.context: Framework showing intelligence resides in network connections and organization rather than individual components; applicable to diverse biological networks.

concepts.name: Credit Assignment Problem
concepts.context: Fundamental challenge in both learning and evolution of how to assign reward/fitness to components when outcomes depend on collective action.

concepts.name: Evolutionary Individuality
concepts.context: Property of a system exhibiting heritable variation in reproductive success at the collective level, distinct from genetic relatedness.

concepts.name: Individuality
concepts.context: Quality making collectives coherent individuals rather than populations; characterized by integration and collective action through cognitive architecture.

concepts.name: Integration
concepts.context: Binding of diverse experiences and information across system components into unified models belonging to the whole.

concepts.name: Collective Action
concepts.context: Orchestrated responses coordinating behaviors across system components toward system-level goals.

concepts.name: Bioelectricity
concepts.context: Ion channel and electrical synapse networks functioning as cognitive substrate binding cells into competent individuals across scales.

concepts.name: Pattern Memory
concepts.context: System-level memory of target anatomical configurations guiding morphogenesis and regeneration despite perturbations.

concepts.name: Homeostatic Loops
concepts.context: Feedback mechanisms maintaining system state toward goal configurations; unified locus of learning and preferences.

concepts.name: Anatomical Homeostasis
concepts.context: Ability to adjust and maintain correct anatomy despite injury or rearrangement through problem-solving in morphospace.

concepts.name: Morphospace
concepts.context: Space of possible anatomical configurations navigated by cellular collectives during development and regeneration.

concepts.name: Multi-Scale Autonomy
concepts.context: Property of organisms exhibiting goal-directed subsystems while maintaining collective coherence; dynamic interplay of competition and cooperation.

concepts.name: Multi-Scale Competency
concepts.context: Architecture where many subsystems are themselves goal-directed, enabling robustness and evolvability.

concepts.name: Evolvability
concepts.context: Capacity of systems to generate heritable phenotypic variation; depends on autonomy of component parts.

concepts.name: Cognition
concepts.context: Algorithmic problem-solving capability observable as adaptive behavior; substrate-independent and characteristic of integrated systems.

concepts.name: Unsupervised Learning
concepts.context: Learning building low-dimensional models of data without external targets or system-level reward feedback; basis for emergent collective intelligence.

concepts.name: Reinforcement Learning
concepts.context: Learning where outputs confer different rewards but correct output unknown; applicable to biological evolution and development.

concepts.name: Hebbian Learning
aliases: Neurons that fire together wire together
concepts.context: Learning mechanism where correlated neural activations strengthen connections; can emerge from local self-interest optimization.

concepts.name: Associative Learning
concepts.context: Learning paradigm where organisms learn relationships between stimuli and consequences.

concepts.name: Deep Auto-Encoder
concepts.context: Neural network compressing high-dimensional input into low-dimensional representation; encodes low-dimensional model of observed samples.

concepts.name: Multi-Layer Perceptron
concepts.context: Neural network with multiple layers capable of representing non-linearly separable functions.

concepts.name: Non-Linearly Separable Functions
concepts.context: Functions where response to one input changes direction based on another input; requires deep network representations.

concepts.name: Planarian Regeneration
concepts.context: Biological model system demonstrating bioelectric control of anatomical target states and memory beyond genetic encoding.

concepts.name: Xenopus Development
concepts.context: Model organism demonstrating developmental plasticity and anatomical problem-solving across perturbations.

concepts.name: Developmental Memory
concepts.context: Persistent information storage in developmental systems enabling recovery from perturbations to achieve target anatomy.

concepts.name: Regeneration
concepts.context: Process of regrowing missing body parts; requires collective decision-making and memory at multiple scales.

concepts.name: Emergence
concepts.context: System properties arising from component interactions over developmental or evolutionary timescales.

concepts.name: Agency
concepts.context: Capacity for autonomous decision-making based on local rewards; can exist at multiple organizational levels simultaneously.

concepts.name: Self
concepts.context: Unified locus of learning, memory, and goal-directed action; emerges from integrated collective organization.

concepts.name: Self-Awareness
concepts.context: Second-order metacognitive property not necessarily required for basal cognition or collective intelligence.

concepts.name: Competency
concepts.context: Degree of problem-solving ability characterizing what makes collectives individuals as opposed to mere populations.

concepts.name: Downward Causation
concepts.context: Causal influence from higher-level collective properties on lower-level component behavior.

concepts.name: Deep Model Induction
concepts.context: Process of inducing hierarchical deep representations enabling rescaling of problem-solving search space.

concepts.name: Major Transitions In Evolution
concepts.context: Origins of new levels of biological organization; hypothesized to correspond to deep interaction structures.

concepts.name: Homeostatic Setpoint
concepts.context: Target state maintained by system-level homeostatic mechanisms; can be shifted via bioelectric modulation.

concepts.name: Dukkha
concepts.context: Buddhist concept of dissatisfaction or constraint; used metaphorically for system perturbations driving learning dynamics.

concepts.name: Problem Space
concepts.context: Abstract space of possible states or solutions navigated by intelligent systems; can exist at multiple organizational levels.

concepts.name: Inductive Bias
concepts.context: Assumptions about learning embedded in network architecture determining generalization properties.

concepts.name: Identity
concepts.context: Coherence and continuity of individual organisms despite cellular turnover and dynamic processes.

concepts.name: Cancer
concepts.context: Disease of dysregulated morphogenesis resulting from disconnection from bioelectric collective control networks.

concepts.name: Genetic Relatedness
concepts.context: Degree of genetic similarity; insufficient alone to define biological individuality or evolutionary units.

concepts.name: Cooperation
concepts.context: Coordinated behavior between components toward collective benefit; dynamic interplay with competition in multi-scale organisms.

concepts.name: Developmental Bioelectricity
concepts.context: Non-genetic patterning information stored in bioelectric gradients that regulates embryogenesis, regeneration, and cancer; enables morphological problem-solving.

concepts.name: Bioelectric Signaling
concepts.context: Ion channel-mediated electrical communication between cells that encodes and transmits pattern information independent of genetic code.

concepts.name: Evolutionary Transitions In Individuality (ETIs)
concepts.context: Evolutionary events where lower-level individuals become integrated into higher-level collective agents; explaining scale transitions in biology.

concepts.name: Bayesian Inference
concepts.context: Theoretical framework for understanding evolution, learning, and biological pattern regulation as inference problems.

concepts.name: Free-Energy Approach To Pattern Regulation
concepts.context: Application of free energy minimization principles to explain how biological systems maintain organized patterns.

concepts.name: Gene Regulatory Networks
concepts.context: Networks of genes and their interactions exhibiting memory, storing developmental information, and enabling adaptive responses.

concepts.name: Associative Memory
concepts.context: Capability to store and recall patterns through correlations in network connections; exhibited by Hopfield networks and biological systems.

concepts.name: Plasticity
concepts.context: Ability of biological systems to modify development or behavior in response to environmental conditions.

concepts.name: Teleonomy
concepts.context: Properties of biological systems exhibiting goal-directed behavior without conscious intention; emergent from morphogenetic collective intelligence.

concepts.name: Self-assembly
concepts.context: Process where components autonomously organize into higher-order structures through local interactions and physical principles.

concepts.name: Membrane Potential (Vmem)
concepts.context: Electrical gradient across cell membranes encoding pattern information; key substrate for morphogenetic signaling.

concepts.name: Gap Junctions
concepts.context: Protein channels enabling electrical and chemical communication between adjacent cells; essential for bioelectric pattern propagation.

concepts.name: Xenopus Tadpole
concepts.context: Key experimental model organism for studying developmental bioelectricity and regenerative mechanisms.

concepts.name: Levels-Of-Selection Approach
concepts.context: Framework for understanding evolution operating at multiple biological scales simultaneously.

concepts.name: Scale-Free Biology
concepts.context: Principle that similar organizational and computational principles operate across different scales of biological organization.

concepts.name: Meta-Stability
concepts.context: Property of bioelectric circuits exhibiting multiple possible stable states with stochastic transitions between them.

concepts.name: Morphological Coordination
concepts.context: Unified function integrating neural and non-neural signaling systems to achieve anatomical coherence.

concepts.name: Particle Plasticity
concepts.context: Variation in particle-like units enabling evolvability and adaptive exploration of developmental space.

concepts.name: Deep Learning
concepts.context: Machine learning approach using multiple layers of artificial neurons; parallels and informs understanding of biological computation.

concepts.name: Natural Induction
concepts.context: Spontaneous adaptive organization emerging in physical networks without explicit programming or design.

concepts.name: Cognitive Lens
concepts.context: Conceptual framework for analyzing cognition in developmental and regenerative morphogenesis across scales.

concepts.name: Minimal Developmental Computation
concepts.context: Causal network approach to understanding minimal requirements for morphogenetic pattern formation and self-organization.

concepts.name: Anatomical Target
concepts.context: Species-specific body form that regenerating tissues actively work to restore through bioelectric signaling.

concepts.name: Bioelectric Tissue Simulation Engine
concepts.context: Computational modeling platform for simulating physiological signaling and emergent morphogenetic patterns.

concepts.name: Extended Inheritance
concepts.context: Transmission of biological information and traits through means other than DNA sequence.

concepts.name: Pattern Regulation
concepts.context: Process by which biological systems maintain consistent patterns despite perturbations and variation.

concepts.name: Developmental Plasticity
concepts.context: Ability of organisms to adjust their development and phenotype in response to environmental signals.

concepts.name: Pleiotropy
concepts.context: Single gene or factor affecting multiple phenotypic traits; creates constraints on evolution.

concepts.name: Technological Approach To Mind Everywhere (TAME)
concepts.context: Experimentally-grounded framework for understanding cognition and agency in diverse biological bodies and systems.

concepts.name: Deep Optimization
concepts.context: Solving combinatorial optimization problems by capturing problem structure through multiple levels of representation.

concepts.name: Evo-Eco
concepts.context: Integration of evolutionary and ecological principles; expanded with learning theory to explain ecosystem dynamics.

concepts.name: Self-Modeling Dynamical System
concepts.context: System that builds and updates internal models of its own behavior to improve problem-solving.

concepts.name: Neurotransmitter Signaling
concepts.context: Use of chemical messengers for long-range and local signaling in development and regeneration.

frameworks.name: Connectionist Framework for Collective Intelligence
frameworks.creator: Watson and Levin
frameworks.context: Unified framework showing how connectionist models of cognition and learning from AI apply to biological collective intelligence across scales.

frameworks.name: Hopfield Network
frameworks.creator: Hopfield
frameworks.context: Simple neural network model with symmetric connections and fixed-point dynamics; demonstrates distributed computation and associative memory.

frameworks.name: Deep Belief Network
frameworks.creator: Hinton et al.
frameworks.context: Layered architecture combining compressed representations and recurrent dynamics; relevant to multi-scale autonomy in organisms.

frameworks.name: Bioelectric Code Manipulation Framework
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Methodology for reading, interpreting, and rewriting bioelectric information controlling morphogenesis without genetic modification.

frameworks.name: Multi-Scale Problem-Solving Architecture
frameworks.context: Framework where organisms navigate problems in different spaces than their parts (morphospace vs. transcriptional space).

frameworks.name: Bioelectrical Coupling Framework
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Theoretical model explaining how gap junctions regulate bioelectric domains to enable multicellular coordination and pattern specification.

frameworks.name: Connectionist Approach To Evolutionary Transitions In Individuality
frameworks.creator: Richard Watson, Michael Levin, Christopher Buckley
frameworks.context: Design framework using connectionist principles to explain how individuals transition to higher levels of organization through interaction networks.

frameworks.name: Universal Darwinism As Bayesian Inference
frameworks.creator: James Campbell, Eörs Szathmáry
frameworks.context: Theoretical framework interpreting evolution, learning, and adaptation as Bayesian inference processes.

frameworks.name: Dynamical Patterning Modules
frameworks.creator: Stuart Newman
frameworks.context: Framework integrating physics and genetics to explain morphological development through physical principles and molecular regulation.

frameworks.name: Facilitated Variation
frameworks.creator: Uri Alon
frameworks.context: Mechanism by which evolution learns from past environments through modular genetic structures to generalize to new conditions.

frameworks.name: Levels Of Selection Approach To Individuality
frameworks.creator: Ellen Clarke
frameworks.context: Framework for understanding biological individuality through analysis of selection operating at multiple hierarchical levels.

institutions.name: University Of Southampton
institutions.context: Institution housing Richard Watson in Electronics and Computer Science and Institute for Life Sciences.

institutions.name: Allen Discovery Center At Tufts University
institutions.context: Research center affiliated with Michael Levin investigating collective intelligence and regenerative medicine.

institutions.name: Wyss Institute For Biologically Inspired Engineering
institutions.context: Harvard-affiliated institute where Michael Levin conducts research on bioengineering and synthetic living systems.

institutions.name: John Templeton Foundation
institutions.context: Funding organization supporting research on consciousness, intelligence, and fundamental questions in biology.

institutions.name: Templeton World Charity Foundation
institutions.context: Charitable foundation providing funding support for research on collective intelligence and related topics.

institutions.name: MIT Media Lab
institutions.context: Interdisciplinary research center where computational and robotics approaches to biological systems are developed.

institutions.name: Frontiers in Systems Neuroscience
institutions.context: Publishing venue and research community for systems-level approaches to understanding neural and biological computation.

questions.question: What exactly constitutes collective intelligence, and what mechanisms enable it?
questions.context: Central question addressed by the paper; identifies ambiguity and domain-specificity of current theories.

questions.question: What kinds of functional relationships between components are necessary and sufficient to turn a non-intelligent collective into an intelligent one?
questions.context: Core theoretical question driving the unified framework of connectionist models across biological scales.

questions.question: How can the principles of individual cognition and learning be extended to understand collective intelligence?
questions.context: Motivates the transfer of well-developed models from neural networks to biological collective systems.

questions.question: How does bioelectric signaling serve as a cognitive substrate for morphogenesis and anatomical control?
questions.context: Key empirical question about the mechanisms linking cognition to anatomical decision-making.

questions.question: Are evolutionary individuality and organismic individuality dependent on the same cognitive architecture?
questions.context: Central conjecture proposing deep equivalence between fitness generation and system-level integration.

questions.question: How can credit assignment problems in evolution and development be solved by distributed learning mechanisms?
questions.context: Addresses fundamental theoretical problem in understanding how coherent individuals emerge from parts.

questions.question: What architectural features distinguish networks capable of representing non-linearly separable functions?
questions.context: Technical question identifying necessary network depth for genuine collective intelligence.

questions.question: Can morphogenesis and regeneration be understood as problem-solving in anatomical morphospace?
questions.context: Reframes developmental biology through cognitive science lens; implies developmental basal cognition.

questions.question: How do single-level ecological networks achieve collective intelligence without system-level selection?
questions.context: Empirical question about unsupervised learning mechanisms in ecological communities.

questions.question: What conditions enable bottom-up emergence of new levels of biological organization?
questions.context: Addresses origin of major transitions in evolution through connectionist learning principles.

questions.question: How can deep models and hierarchical architectures enable multi-scale autonomy in organisms?
questions.context: Technical question about network structures enabling simultaneous agency at multiple scales.

questions.question: Can bioelectric manipulation enable predictive control over morphogenesis without genetic changes?
questions.context: Empirical prediction from bioelectric code framework; demonstrated in planaria and other species.

questions.question: What are the practical implications of collective intelligence principles for synthetic bioengineering?
questions.context: Question about engineering living systems through manipulation of cognitive collective relationships.

questions.question: How might understanding collective intelligence improve regenerative medicine and cancer treatment?
questions.context: Applied question about medical applications of collective intelligence research.

questions.question: Is cognition fundamentally substrate-independent, or are there constraints on implementations?
questions.context: Ontological question about whether cognition is genuinely universal across biological networks.

questions.question: What is the minimal physical substrate required for cognition, and how does this relate to bioelectrical signaling in cells?
questions.context: Challenges traditional views limiting cognition to brains; asks whether information processing and goal-directed behavior constitute cognition universally.

questions.question: How do cells collectively solve morphogenetic problems without centralized control or neural computation?
questions.context: Core question about distributed intelligence in biological development; central to understanding regeneration and pattern formation.

questions.question: What constitutes a unified biological individual, and how do individuals transition to higher levels of collective organization?
questions.context: Addresses fundamental question of biological identity and major evolutionary transitions; relevant to understanding cancer and synthetic organisms.

questions.question: How can bioelectric states encode and specify complex body plans independently of genetic information?
questions.context: Questions relationship between genetic and non-genetic inheritance; challenges central dogma understanding of biological information.

questions.question: Can machine learning principles and algorithms help explain biological evolution and development?
questions.context: Asks whether AI learning theory provides explanatory power for understanding biological adaptation and morphogenesis.

questions.question: How should we design AI systems to exhibit goal-directed behavior and embodied cognition comparable to biological systems?
questions.context: Practical question about whether bioelectric principles and distributed coordination can inform artificial intelligence design.

questions.question: What is the relationship between cancer and disruption of bioelectric pattern maintenance and cellular collective intelligence?
questions.context: Suggests cancer as problem of scaling and boundary of self; implications for novel therapeutic approaches.

questions.question: How can synthetic organisms with alternative morphologies or substrates achieve goal-directed adaptive behavior?
questions.context: Explores whether cognition and agency are substrate-independent and instantiable in non-biological systems.

questions.question: What are the implications of scale-free cognition for understanding consciousness and subjective experience?
questions.context: Raises questions about whether consciousness exists across scales of biological organization beyond the nervous system.

questions.question: How do evolutionary and developmental processes interact to produce evolvability and adaptive potential?
questions.context: Integrates evo-devo principles with learning theory to understand how biological systems improve their capacity to evolve.
